column4: Everytime I boot ubuntu from the hdd, it stops loading after Mounting Root Filesystem. If I boot using the recovery kernel, I get a kernel panic. I have the livecd here, and I can boot up with that. I'm wondering if there would be a way to restore the kernel from the livecd boot, I don't want to lose everything with a reformat :(
then there is probably some issue with how you have your paritions
: I don't think so, it worked fine for awhile, then one time I rebooted and it hasen't worked since. I only have 1 partition, using all the hdd space.
then there might be an error with your grub settings
